verses.roman:
kṛṣṇasyānanta-vīryasya
yoga-māyā-mahodayam
muhur dṛṣṭvā ṛṣir abhūd
vismito jāta-kautukaḥ

synonyms: kṛṣṇasya—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; ananta—unlimited; vīryasya—whose prowess; yoga-māyā—of the mystic, deluding energy; mahā—elaborate; udayam—the manifestation; muhuḥ—repeatedly; dṛṣṭvā—having witnessed; ṛṣiḥ—the sage, Nārada; abhūt—became; vismitaḥ—amazed; jātakautukaḥ—filled with wonder.
translation: Having repeatedly seen the vast mystic display of Lord Kṛṣṇa, whose power is unlimited, the sage was amazed and filled with wonder.
